intro: Acaroides, commonly known as the "false nettle," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. These plants are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. They typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Acaroides species are often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant's botanical features include a smooth stem and a basal rosette of leaves.
